alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Franklin (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 11:40PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Franklin and northeastern Crawford Counties through 1215 AM CST... At 1140 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Mulberry, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and dime to penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Ozark... Charleston... Mulberry... Altus... Branch... Denning... Wiederkehr Village... Cass... Fern... Jethro... Turners Bend... Vesta... Cecil... Lonelm... Etna... Barnes... Alix... Redding... Watalula... Meg... This includes Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 22 and 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for northwestern and west central Arkansas.
